comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: Feb 13, 1913, NYTImes: The cycle of "Der Ring des Nibelungen" was continued yesterday afternoon with a performance of "Siegfried" before a large holiday audience. It was an excellent one in almost all respects, and had one special interest from the fact that it brought before this public for the second time the new German tenor of the company, Mr. Jacques Urlus as Siegfried.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Jacques Urlus (January 6, 1867 in Hergenrath, near Aachen - June 6, 1935 in Noordwijk, Netherlands), was a Dutch dramatic tenor. His records of the music of Richard Wagner are considered to be among the finest ever made. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacques_Urlus

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks for the information. We'll update the source data and reload the description.
